pull.title: Mark BIP21 as replaced by 321, update 321 from Draft to Proposed
pull.body: Not sure what the right timeline for this is, but at some point this should happen.

labels.name: PR Author action required
labels.description: Needs updates, has unaddressed review comments, or is otherwise waiting for PR author

events.body: For the timeline, BIP 321 should probably be Proposed or Final.
Okay, went ahead and marked 321 as Proposed as well.

events.message: Mark BIP 21 as replaced (by BIP 321) and mark BIP 321 as Proposed

events.body:
CI happy now.

Per BIP 2, "A BIP may only change status from Draft (or Rejected) to Proposed, when the author deems it is complete, has a working implementation (where applicable), and has community plans progress it to the Final status."

BIP21 implementations are BIP321-compliant, but is there a working 321-specific implementation, can add a Reference Implementation section to BIP 321?
@TheBlueMatt Is there a BIP 321 reference implementation you would suggest?

rename.to: Mark BIP21 as replaced by 321, update 321 from Draft to Proposed

events.body: ACK, adding reference impl can be done in a follow-up
